intro: Hymenasplenium cardiophyllum, commonly known as the heart-leaf spleenwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial moss-like plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant has a distinctive rosette-like structure with leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its common name. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, develop on the upper surface of the leaves and produce spores for propagation. Hymenasplenium cardiophyllum plays a role in nutrient cycling and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
